title: Colors - British Standard

metadata.description: Learn about Colors - British Standard with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
The British Standards for colors is called BS 381.
These hex values are non official approximate values intended to simulate the BS 
381 in HTML:
Hex
Color
Code
Name

BRITISH STANDARD 4800
The BS 4800 standard specifies 122 colors for building and construction 
works.
The colors where intended for major works, such as office blocks, airports, 
schools and hospitals.
These hex values are non official approximate values intended to simulate the British Standard 4800 in HTML:
Hex
Color
Code
Name
#deded2
00-A-01
Ash grey / Oyster grey / Portland
#b5b8b3

Flint grey / Flint
#385552

02-C-33

EXTENDED BRITISH STANDARD BS 4800
The BS 4800 also includes 22 additional bright colors to reflect the latest 
trends for public buildings.
Most of the these colors are recognized  in the UK, and often used to 
meet safety, legal or contractual requirements.
These hex values are non official approximate values intended to simulate the 
BS 4800 extensions in HTML:
Hex
Color
Code
Name
#fee7d5
04 C 31
Pink

The correct definition of British Standard

The British Standards for colors is 'called BS 381'.

summary: This tutorial covers Colors - British Standard concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Colors - British Standard effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Colors - British Standard and how to apply it in your projects.
